intro: Ixia frederickii, commonly known as the Orange Kaffir lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a bulbous root system typical of many Amaryllidaceae species. Ixia frederickii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its vibrant blooms make it a valuable addition to gardens seeking color during the cooler months.
